etymology.description: Pictogram — a knife; original form 𠚣, seen in a variant of 利 (𥝢) and atop 黎.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a knife with a distinct blade and handle. The graph was streamlined into the current two-stroke form and also serves as a component in characters like 利 and 黎.

examples.chinese: 他拿着一把刀(他拿著一把刀)。
厨师用刀切蔬菜(廚師用刀切蔬菜)。
examples.english: The chef uses a knife to cut vegetables.

examples.chinese: 这把刀很锋利(這把刀很鋒利)。
